A Constant Peril 

     For years there has been a growing tendency for men placed in positions of responsibility to lord it over God's heritage, thus removing from church members their 
                                                                           478
keen sense of the need of divine instruction and an appreciation of the privilege to counsel with God regarding their duty. This order of things must be changed. There must be a reform. Men who have not a rich measure of that wisdom which cometh from above should not be called to serve in positions where their influence means so much to church members.
